-DfYYoZTbnE.Name: ‚ÄúSeeds of Peace‚Äù Prem Rawat at Lambeth College, London
-DfYYoZTbnE.Description:
In collaboration with community activists, local law enforcement, and other community leaders, the Peace is Possible campaign was officially launched in June, 2018, with the ‚ÄúSeeds of Peace‚Äù event in London‚Äôs community of Lambeth.

In conversation with Pastor Lorraine Jones, who is a leader in the effort to resolve youth violence in her community, Prem Rawat shared his understanding of the root causes of violence, and offered his practical path to change.

We hope you are inspired by the courage and compassion required to make a difference. Access this full-length recording with your TimelessToday Classic or Premier subscription. 

https://www.timelesstoday.tv/seeds-of-peace-lambeth-video?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=des

-KWGm0RWsFI.Name: Mauke Ki Pehchan - ‡§Æ‡•å‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§™‡§π‡§ö‡§æ‡§®
-KWGm0RWsFI.Description:
Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) presents the message of peace of Prem Rawat and undertakes humanitarian activities to bring harmony in life. It organises live events with Prem Rawat and video events related to his message. His message is‚ÄîPeace is Possible for everyone and that peace is a fundamental need of every human being.
The organisation is dedicated to helping people explore human potential, the joy of being alive and experiencing peace. RVK in its endeavour to improve the quality of human life offers many humanitarian services, including Free Eye Clinics and Food for People in remote areas. It also supports other organisations having similar charitable, social and philanthropic goals.

Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) shares and supports the vision that peace is possible in everybody‚Äôs life. This can happen only when each individual takes personal responsibility and discovers personal peace within. Its activities are supported by voluntary contributions of individuals who appreciate this message. 

Helping You Discover Personal Peace Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) invites Prem Rawat to address people interested in his message of Self-discovery and Self-knowledge. His addresses are very much appreciated and over 50 million people have benefited from them. The number of attendees often exceeds 300,000 at events addressed by Prem Rawat. Prem Rawat presents and offers a practical way to focus within to enjoy the experience of peace inside. Peace Education Programme - From Darkness Into Light. Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) also organises events regularly in jails across the country. His message has helped many prisoners to revert back to the normal life of a law-abiding citizen.
Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) is a non-¬≠profit registered charitable organization

-Qi5Bp1TRjI.Name: Prem Rawat LIVE, from Kyoto
-Qi5Bp1TRjI.Description:
Save the Date!
Friday, May 16, 2025
2:00 P.M. JST (5:00 A.M. UTC)
Prem Rawat in Kyoto, Japan
LiveStream on TimelessToday¬Æ

In English with Simultaneous Translation in French | Hindi | Italian | Spanish

‚ÄúThe value of understanding the self is to make a contribution to your own life, to bring forth goodness in your life, to bring forth joy in your life, to bring strength in your life.‚Äù Prem Rawat

Amid the natural beauty of springtime in Kyoto, Prem Rawat returns to Japan with his profound and universal message.

During his October 2016 Kyoto visit, he posed a simple question: "Who are you?" He continued, ‚ÄúYou are more than you understand. You are the decision-maker for your existence. And the day you become the source of your own inspiration, that is the day you will understand what peace is all about."

Join the celebrations surrounding the release of Prem Rawat‚Äôs latest book "Breath" and discover what it means to become the source of your own inspiration.

Virtual Attendance
Can't make it to Kyoto? TimelessToday¬Æ will livestream the event to all Classic and Premier subscribers on the app and website, with a replay available soon after.

This livestream will be in English with simultaneous French, Hindi, Italian and Spanish translation.

Be sure to turn on notifications in the Settings menu of your TimelessToday app.

Sahitya Tak - Welcome to the rich world of Hindi Literature. From books to stories to poetry, essays, novels and more, Sahitya Tak is a melting pot where you will keep abreast of what's the latest in the field of literature. We also delve into our history and culture as we explore literary gems of yesteryears from Surdas, Kabir, Tulsi, Bhartendu, Premchand, Prasad, Nirala, Dinkar, Mahadevi, etc. To know more about how literature shapes our society and reflects our culture subscribe to Sahitya Tak for enriching stories, poems, shayari, ghazals, kawali and much more. 0578a1e3-bf5b-4c14-86fb-3b2157d1ed7e.Name: Sweet Reality
0578a1e3-bf5b-4c14-86fb-3b2157d1ed7e.Description:
One 2 One with Prem Rawat | No. 20


Prem Rawat:

All stories begin with ‚ÄúOnce upon a time.‚Äù The story that I really want to tell you also begins like this, but there is a small difference‚Äîand the difference is, ‚ÄúOnce upon this time there lives you.‚Äù

Hello everyone‚ÄîPrem Rawat here. I‚Äôve finally made it all the way to India‚Äîand this is where I‚Äôm recording this broadcast. So, a long journey, (obviously, from, all the way from California to Delhi). You know, just reflecting on that, we have a journey too‚Äîand the journey is the journey of this life.

Now, it doesn‚Äôt‚Äîit may not feel like it. It may feel like, ‚ÄúWell, what journey? You know, every day I wake up‚Äù in this, whatever, wherever you live‚Äîyou are there; you have your chores; you have your things that you have to do. And a lot of things don‚Äôt change.

But believe me, change is afoot all the time. And something, very fundamentally, is always changing. And little by little, this incredible amount of time that you had on this earth is being chiseled away.

Now, this is not‚ÄîI know this is not a pleasant topic to talk about. But it‚Äôs a realistic topic to talk about. Because I think it sets the context for all that that we do, all that we think, all that we want to do. Because what is the reality? And sometimes when that word ‚Äúreality‚Äù is said, it‚Äôs very confronting. It‚Äôs like ‚ÄúWhat do you mean‚Äîwhat, what reality? This is reality, isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

There are people‚Äîand they cannot think beyond their business, beyond their, whatever little circle that they have. There it is, their apartment; there it is, their town; there it is, their country. And yet, none of it was ever like that.

There was a time when very much, on this planet Earth, everything was just too hot, too inhospitable to even survive, for anything to survive.

And as millions and millions and millions of years that it took. And when somebody says that, it‚Äôs very hard to understand‚Äîbut it is true. And it took a long, long time to go through all of that to get to a point where we have the earth where it can support the life that it supports. And that we came. We are alive. And one day we‚Äôll be gone.

So, everything on the face of this earth is transitory. Now, a lot of people who had some time; they could sit down; they could observe this‚Äîand in their wisdom, this is what they said, is that ‚ÄúThis is transitory; this isn‚Äôt here permanently. It may seem to you that way‚Äîbut it isn‚Äôt. It all moves. It isn‚Äôt what you think.‚Äù

Yesterday I did a broadcast in Hindi‚Äîso, one of the things I was saying is just like, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre sitting in a train.‚Äù And, you know, it‚Äôs the theory of relativity, but ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre in a train‚Äîand you‚Äôre moving.‚Äù And of course, you don‚Äôt look like you are moving; everything else is moving.

So, that window that you‚Äôre looking out of, it‚Äôs like, well, just right there‚Äîit‚Äôs always been there since the train started moving. And it was the trees that went by. But in reality, it isn‚Äôt the trees that are moving. It is the train that you are in that is moving.

So, if you take a ball and you start bouncing it up and down‚Äîand the train is moving at a hundred kilometers an hour, well, that ball is moving a hundred kilometers an hour in relation to what is outside.

It is quite, just up and down‚Äîin relation to the train itself. But in relation to all the trees that are out there, the mountain that‚Äôs out there, people that are out there, that ball is clipping right along at a hundred kilometers an hour.

So it‚Äôs relative. And where we are, it is very hard for us to see what is moving, what is happening, what is the reality. So, we automatically assume a reality. We think that ‚ÄúThis is the way the world is,‚Äù the way we observe it. ‚ÄúThis is‚Äîah, well, yeah, of course, this is how it‚Äôs going to be; this is this way; this is this way; this is this way.‚Äù

But none of that is real. That you, in your body, you live, you exist every day like you‚Äôre going to live forever, but you‚Äôre not! So what, what exactly is that all about? So, what is reality, then?

And at first, it may be that, you know, you think about it or you look at it and it‚Äôs like, very confronting. But then when you start to just settle down, (yes, yeah, you‚Äôve got to settle down)‚Äîand go ‚ÄúWait a minute. Maybe that reality is very sweet; maybe that reality is very beautiful. Not abrupt and harsh as I take it to be.‚Äù

But it is a sweet reality that I have been given a time to be on the face of this earth. And it‚Äôs a gift! I don‚Äôt know how it happened. I didn‚Äôt‚ÄîI certainly didn‚Äôt push any buttons‚Äîbut I‚Äôm here. One day, I will be gone.

And my focus isn‚Äôt about going. I know there are people who absolutely do not want to concentrate on one second of being alive. They want to concentrate on the departure: ‚ÄúAre we going to end up in heaven, or are we going to end up in hell?‚Äù

This‚ÄîI mean, the heaven‚Äîthey‚Äôre so obsessed with heaven! And they have never been there. It‚Äôs not like they actually have any firsthand experience of it‚Äîno, it‚Äôs just people describing it. And those people who are describing it also haven‚Äôt been there.

But you are here. Nobody has to describe what it is like‚Äîthat early in the morning, when the sun begins, there is a pinkness. And it is so sweet. And the coming of this light, not abruptly but ever so gently, slowly, slowly, slowly, slowly filling up, filling up that sky that was so dark, with this gentle, gentle light.

The fact that that sun that is so bright, that‚Äôs so brilliant, that is so powerful, can bring on its light so sweetly, so gently is almost inconceivable‚Äîbut so it is!

And then there is the water. And, you know, somebody actually said, ‚ÄúWhy do we call it ‚Äòearth‚Äô; it‚Äôs mostly all water!‚Äù It‚Äôs true. And there‚Äôs the ocean, supporting all this life in its bosom, in its self. Lapping against the shorelines, making a sound that is so beautiful, so relaxing to human beings.

The birds that can sing, the wind that can blow. This amazing earth, we do not consider it to be a heaven. But I have heard no description of heaven, ever, that surpasses what this earth is.

So, we will gladly exchange, (as if it were), everything‚Äîfor somebody‚Äôs description. What about your experience? What about your experience? What have you experienced; what do you feel; what do you see? What is that joy like in your life when you love? What is that joy like in your existence when you feel that contentment?

Yeah, we pursue happiness. But we don‚Äôt understand the nature of happiness; it keeps changing. What made you happy two weeks ago isn‚Äôt what‚Äôs going to make you happy today. But contentment is different. Contentment is all about you being in that place where you feel that tranquility.

Can you afford in your life to slow down enough to feel what this existence is all about? Can you slow down enough in your life to feel what this breath is all about? Can you take your ambitions and focus them on wanting to feel, not happiness, but contentment? Can you take this energy that you‚Äôre constantly putting towards the outside, into the world‚Äîand take that focus and put it on the inside?

And be prepared to feel the simplicity, the simplicity of the entire universe as it permeates everything that is there? Even though there is so much action; there is so much going on in this universe, there is a simplicity, and that simplicity, that profoundness is also reflected inside of you. And you have the possibility to feel that.

You know, ‚Äúgood things‚Äù in life is understanding them, accepting them. If somebody loves you, you can hate them. And you can hate them, and all you will feel is hate. Or, you can also start accepting that love. And that the love that, from acceptance of that love, the love that‚Äôll come from you, that‚Äôll be generated inside of you, you can feel that too.

Hate begets hate. Anger begets anger. Fear begets fear. True. Very, very true. But conversely, love begets love. Joy begets joy.

Is this different? Is this wrong? There‚Äôs no judgment. It is. This is what makes you human; you live in this paradox. And yet, there is one part of you that thinks this is a paradox. And there is another part of you that knows that this is not a paradox. It is in fact, your reality‚Äîyour reality.

And that is‚Äîthat is absolutely amazing‚Äîthat that is your reality. It could be anything. And one of the things is, yes, you can imagine things in life. Oh, yeah, there are many things you can imagine in life. But there is a reality as well that you must accept.

So, I don‚Äôt say to people, ‚ÄúYou should not run with your imagination‚Äù‚Äîof course you should run with your imagination if you want to. Whatever you want to do‚Äîprovided you also accept the reality that is here. Because it‚Äôs a sweet reality; it‚Äôs a beautiful reality. It‚Äôs your reality. It‚Äôs your understanding; it‚Äôs about you! Your life is about you.

I mean, and you know, yeah, people, well, it‚Äôs like, ‚ÄúOh yeah, well, you know, that‚Äôs not the right way to think about life; that‚Äôs not the right way to think about this, you know, and but that‚Äôs, that‚Äôs too selfish....‚Äù

Come on, please! Please. Where does this breath take place, in somebody else‚Äîor in you? Where do you feel joy, in somewhere else, or in you? So, why is it that you feel joy inside of you? And why is it‚Äîmost importantly‚Äîthat you want to feel joy? Why do you want to feel joy? Have you ever asked that question? Why do you want to feel joy?

Ask it. Ask the question. And if you do ask that question, you will find out that inside of you, within you is that pot that yearns to be filled. You can call it a pot; you can call it a heart. You can‚Äîyou can call it ‚Äúyou,‚Äù for that matter. It‚Äôs sweet! It‚Äôs beautiful. And that‚Äôs the way the kindness of this universe is.

There is utter destruction, absolute destruction‚Äîand then there is existence. And both are allowed to coexist. It‚Äôs not like it‚Äôs all being destroyed. Of course, it‚Äôll, eventually, ‚Äúall being destroyed‚Äù but before it is all destroyed, it is allowed to exist. And it is allowed to go in destruction mode only to be recreated again. Wow‚Äîonly to be recreated again.

And maybe never the same, everything a little bit different. A sun could be destroyed‚Äîand end up as a satellite moon. To all of this, the change. We don‚Äôt like to change. We don‚Äôt want to change. But change is inevitable; that‚Äôs going to happen.

That‚Äôs what Marcus Aurelius said. Change, change, change takes place. Do you like it? Do you want it? Maybe not. Because you work so hard to shore up everything to make sure that it doesn‚Äôt change. And then somebody comes along and says, ‚ÄúNo, it has to change.‚Äù And that‚Äôs very inconvenient. That‚Äôs, and that, that‚Äôs not fun.

So? Not looking at the time now‚Äîand projecting it in hell and heaven, ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôll be much better after I die.‚Äù And yet, who comes back and says ‚ÄúOh, yeah, yeah, everything is cool‚Äù? And who says, ‚ÄúWell, you know, I, I‚Äôll expedite‚Äù? Nobody wants to expedite‚Äînot in their right mind, anyways, not in a sane way.

So, we do‚Äîand we are in this paradox. But in this paradox, there is an incredible clarity. And that clarity is so beautiful and it‚Äôs so profound. And that‚Äôs what we have got to latch onto. And if we can, it can be the most beautiful thing in our life.

We can be thankful for this existence. We can appreciate, in a unique way, in our unique way, what we have been given, what has been made possible. And that‚Äôs where gratitude comes from. The want to know yourself is there.

A lot of people will go, ‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt want to know myself. I, I don‚Äôt have that want. I don‚Äôt‚ÄîI, I don‚Äôt care!‚Äù But you do. And when you were growing up, that was one of the things that mattered an incredible amount to you‚Äîeven if you, you know, say ‚ÄúOh, it didn‚Äôt, didn‚Äôt matter to me,‚Äù oh yeah, it did.

What did you like? Which ice cream flavor did you like? What was your favorite dish‚Äîand that wasn‚Äôt the same dish as everybody else‚Äôs. What color clothes did you wear? What was your favorite color? This is all in the search of identity, of trying to identify who you are.

When you were born, you know, your‚Äîthe center of your universe was that person who was caring for you. Your mother‚Äîand things were maybe very, very simple; most of the time you slept‚Äîwhen you felt hunger, you woke up. Then went back to sleep.

Things changed, changed, changed‚Äîyou started to become aware; you started to become aware; you started to become aware of this; you started to become aware of that. And most importantly, you started to become aware of yourself.

And you wanted an identity: ‚ÄúThis is who I am.‚Äù Of course, there was a name. But it went far beyond name. It also went to everything else. What color you like, what, you know, what is your favorite day, to, you know, ‚ÄúDo you like going to school?‚Äù ‚ÄúAnd I don‚Äôt like the going to school.‚Äù

Who are your friends; who, you know, your.... You may have a friend; then all of a sudden, that friend isn‚Äôt your friend anymore. Whatever. Seeking that identity. And what is the most important thing of seeking that identity? Knowing your self. Knowing the self.

So, there, it was just related to colors or this or that or all the other little things. Then, there is the whole idea of the, take it one whole step beyond that‚Äîand really find out who you are, not just the colors, (your favorite color or your favorite day or your favorite dish or your ‚Äúfavorite this‚Äù or your ‚Äúfavorite that‚Äù).

Who really, as a human being, you are‚Äînot your personality‚Äîbut the components of your existence. What do you have inside of you? Do you have that incredible joy?

That you have anger, that you have fear. That you have hate. But you also have incredible‚Äîsee, this is the component. With this‚Äîin the world, we don‚Äôt think of these things. But these, this is all part of knowing yourself.

Now, you don‚Äôt abandon one for the other. (What your favorite color is will remain your favorite color. And who your favorite person is will remain your favorite person.) But! Then starting to understand the depth, that there is more than meets the eye.

Know yourself, always. Know and understand the thirst for the contentment that you have. Because that contentment is important to you; this is one of the components that is required by you.

You think it‚Äôs just happiness. But happiness comes and goes. That‚Äôs its nature‚Äîand that‚Äôs perfectly okay. That doesn‚Äôt make happiness wrong. That doesn‚Äôt make happiness wrong. That‚Äôs perfectly okay. But contentment is what you truly desire. Then the want isn‚Äôt there anymore. It‚Äôs a different state of being.

It‚Äôs like, there you are. And you‚Äôre lying there‚Äîand you want to go to sleep, and you can‚Äôt go to sleep and you‚Äôre turning and you‚Äôre tossing and‚Äîand then finally, it happens. And you fall asleep. Contentment.

‚ÄúI want this. I want that. I, yeah, I think I need this; I think I need that. I need to be better than the other people. I need to do this; I need to do that. I,‚Äù da, da-da, da-da, da-da, da! And then, (whew), just you. How beautiful, how simple‚Äîhow profound that is. And this is the only way you will be able to have that gratitude that you need in your life.

And what is the significance of gratitude? The significance of gratitude is that then, that contentment is afoot. And as a result of that, here comes gratitude. So, it‚Äôs never one gift‚Äîit‚Äôs one gift and then another gift‚Äîand then another gift, and then another gift. It‚Äôs like a tree.

And before the season, what can it give you? It can give you shade. It can give you a support. You can lie against it and rest. And then, when the season comes, it gives you a fruit.

Life can be like that‚Äîif we let life be life, and not try to manipulate it, not try to change it. Otherwise, there‚Äôs so much out there that‚Äôs so unbelievable! And it‚Äôs in our world! You know, it, and this is the time we live in.

So, make the most, make the most of this existence that you have. Somehow, it‚Äôs incredibly important that you do.

So, thank you very much; stay well; stay safe. And I will talk to you soon.

060c82c5-1468-4008-90c7-98a35063f32c.Name: The Ultimate Culprit
060c82c5-1468-4008-90c7-98a35063f32c.Description: All over the world, fights break out for a simple reason. We‚Äôre not listening to each other. There‚Äôs so much noise going on, but we still have to choose what to hear.

06146bac-ce26-40b2-afe2-a78ed54a4fd0.Name: 123rd Hans Jayanti Celebration 2023
06146bac-ce26-40b2-afe2-a78ed54a4fd0.Description:
On November 8, 2023, in Delhi, India, a small gathering joined by 8,000 livestream viewers honored the 123rd birth anniversary of Prem Rawat's father and teacher, Shri Maharaji. 

During the event, Prem Rawat described the responsibility that the teacher accepts to help students experience that which is indescribable and can‚Äôt be understood with your intellect. 

Embracing his father‚Äôs vision to reach people beyond India, the gift of Self-Knowledge has touched the lives of individuals in more than 110 countries worldwide.

06c17596-0279-4293-8a26-f86d5f58eae2.Name: Champions of Hope - complete
06c17596-0279-4293-8a26-f86d5f58eae2.Description: Prem Rawat came to South Africa to speak about peace in 1972. He was 14 years old. Nelson Mandela was in prison, serving a life sentence (before his 1990 publish) for his attempts to overturn its brutal Apartheid regime. When government officials discovered that the young Prem was addressing racially mixed audiences, they told him he could only speak to segregated racial groups. Prem refused, and the government blacklisted him. He was probably the youngest person ever to be blacklisted by the Apartheid regime for refusing to hold segregated events. Standing up to the regime was an extraordinary example of Prem‚Äôs courage.

A historic event in Lucknow, India!
Prem Rawat‚Äôs book, ‚ÄúHear Yourself‚Äù in Hindi, "Swayam ki Awaz" set a Guinness World Record on April 2, 2023

Following a typhoon that hit Lucknow, India only days before Prem Rawat‚Äôs Author Event on April 2, 2023, over 114,000 people gathered for the launch of the Hindi version of his book, ‚ÄúHear Yourself.‚Äù  An additional virtual audience of 8,923 logged in from 86 countries.

The bestselling author read from his ‚ÄúHear Yourself‚Äù book, Chapter 3: ‚ÄúGround Yourself in Infinite Peace,‚Äù in Hindi, and answered questions from the Indian actress, Bhagayashree, who joined him on stage.

Surprising the audience at the end of the event, an adjudicator from Guinness World Records came on stage and announced that Prem Rawat had smashed the 2018 prior record for the largest audience attending a single author‚Äôs reading. Congratulations, Prem Rawat!

34dc4d60-a171-449f-b925-6b48654b20e2.Description:
Prem Rawat in Dublin, Ireland Prem Rawat returned to Dublin on July 27, 2025, two years after his last visit, for an inspiring author event. Paul Congdon, owner of Positive Life magazine, introduced Prem and his latest book with characteristic Irish warmth. As he so often does, Prem Rawat shared a powerful metaphor: just as the sun provides all colors that objects reflect back, the divine offers a spectrum of human qualities ‚Äî joy, peace, kindness and love ‚Äî that become our true "colors." He explored the tension between the world's external pressures and the divine's gentle guidance toward the authentic self where the nature of peace and understanding reside. Central to his message: Breath is our most precious and overlooked gift, connecting us to all life and serving as a gateway to the ancient wisdom "Know thyself."

“What Is Shaping You?” • Prem Rawat in Dublin, Ireland • 60 min. Enjoy any time on the TimelessToday app/website

3X4FzZW3v_A.Name: Hear Yourself (Intro)
3X4FzZW3v_A.Description:
For anyone pursuing answers to their own life, Prem Rawat‚Äôs latest book, ‚ÄúHear Yourself: How to Find Peace in a Noisy World,‚Äù takes you on a journey to quiet the noise inside and outside of us.  Based on ancient wisdom, and his more than 55 years committed to educating and inspiring people around the world, Prem Rawat reconnects individuals to their heart.

‚ÄúI invite you to walk with me for a while, and you will be surprised by the paths we take.  We will deviate from theories and beliefs and move towards a unique form of knowledge that lies
within us, free from the distractions of everyday life, a place where you will find clarity, fulfillment, and joy.  A place of inner peace.‚Äù ‚ÄîPrem Rawat

Born in 1957 in the Himalayan foothills, Prem Rawat learned from his father, a respected
teacher.  He began carrying his message of peace around the world as a teenager and has
reached hundreds of millions of people in more than 100 countries.

He created the Prem Rawat Foundation (TPRF.org) to help address basic human needs and to provide insights into individual peace, no matter what your life‚Äôs circumstances are.  He lives in Los Angeles with his family and travels around the world every year, meeting and inspiring people interested in his practical approach to life.

3a6e64b5-d4d7-44db-bbd6-21539d51f01f.Name: Prem Rawat on SABC News
3a6e64b5-d4d7-44db-bbd6-21539d51f01f.Description: There are 53 million people living in South Africa, the only country in the world that borders both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans.  On December 8th, 11 million of these people had a rare opportunity to listen to a live interview with Prem Rawat on South Africa‚Äôs oldest radio station, SAfm. The interviewer, long time-radio host, Rowena Baird, began the show with a bold declaration.  ‚ÄúInternational Peace Ambassador, Mr. Prem Rawat‚Äù, she explained, ‚Äúwas going to share some tips on how to eliminate violence through reconciliation, hope, and forgiveness.‚Äù  Bold, indeed, and timely, too. Returning to a country that had blacklisted him for refusing to abide by Apartheid principles at his Johannesburg public event in 1972,  Prem was now being given a country-wide platform to share his message of peace.  Which is precisely what he did for 13 power-packed minutes.  Responding to Ms. Baird‚Äôs questions with his own unique brand of straight talk, storytelling, and humor, Prem laid it all on the line ‚Äì especially in response to the last question ‚Äì about his specific message for South Africans. ‚ÄúYou have the power,‚Äù he exclaimed.  ‚ÄúAll you need is that determination. Don‚Äôt look at other people. Look at yourself.  From the strength of you ‚Äì you can change a nation.‚Äù Written by Mitch Ditkoff

3bbae608-ff53-4f75-a6b8-d32402017113.Name: Session 9, 50th Anniversary
3bbae608-ff53-4f75-a6b8-d32402017113.Description:
Amaroo 2016 Celebration Series


Prem Rawat in Ivory's Rock Conference and Events Center, Ipswich, 2016. 
A 5-day conference celebrating the 50th anniversary of his relentless efforts to spread the message of peace.

For the past 50 years, Prem Rawat has been focused on one simple goal ‚Äì to communicate his message of peace to as many people as possible.  His efforts have been relentless and the results have been extraordinary ‚Äì but never as extraordinary as this past year. Indeed, in 2016, Prem reached more people than ever before.

In September 2016, 4,500 of these people attended a five-day event with Prem at the Ivory‚Äôs Rock Conference and Event Center (aka Amaroo) in Australia. By all accounts, the event was a most remarkable one.

Today, in honor of the holiday season and the many requests we‚Äôve received, we are happy to announce the launch of an online 50th Anniversary Gift Set.  This comprehensive collection includes nine of Prem‚Äôs addresses from the 5-day celebration with material not seen before on TimelessToday.  It also features many of the extraordinary stories he told in Amaroo from the Mahabharata ‚Äì a classic Indian epic infused with enduring principles still relevant today.
 

Written by Mitch Ditkoff

Amaroo 2022 with Prem Rawat


September 6, the Focus 5 event continued with a reminder that the objective of life is to thrive, not survive. He encouraged everyone to learn to let that which is beneficial sink in and let the rest go, and be attracted to that beautiful, that attractive state within each of us. Focus where there is no fear, doubt or envy.

Prem referenced the words of Krishna saying ‚ÄúWhatever you think about most in your life, you will remember that at your last minute.‚Äù Asking the question, ‚ÄúDo we remember gratitude or are we only trying to find solutions to problems?‚Äù

 Recognizing that during these past few years, many have seen the loss of loved ones, Prem encouraged everyone to put the sadness aside and celebrate them, allow them to live on in memory - celebrate them in your heart. He added the practical perspective that you can‚Äòt celebrate them with sadness.

4775a866-655a-4f72-8987-a0c83c5dba9d.Description:
A public event was held in Delhi, India on Dec. 3, 2023 with Prem Rawat, peace educator, New York Times and Irish Times bestselling author and  Guinness World Records holder.

Each of Prem Rawat‚Äôs public speeches has as its core the message that life is precious and don‚Äôt waste the opportunity. Speaking to more than 50,000 attendees in Delhi and nearly 7,000 virtual viewers, he emphasized the importance of focusing on those experiences in life which bring you closer to knowing  yourself. Prem reminded everyone listening that you have choices that can bring you closer or further away from your true self. He also explained that it was his job, as he tours the world, to remind us that what may feel complicated is quite simple.

From the stage, the author was given an award by HarperCollins India, the publisher of his Indian version of the bestseller, ‚ÄúHear Yourself,‚Äù for its amazing success and impact on so many lives. The publisher encouraged readers of the book to share its life-changing content.


The replay of this Delhi event, the final stop on this India tour, is now available on the TimelessToday¬Æ app and website with your Classic or Premiere subscription.

491b0c0a-f026-42e2-8524-00fa509e5c13.Name: Session 2: 124th Hans Jayanti Celebration
491b0c0a-f026-42e2-8524-00fa509e5c13.Description:
Replay of livestream with Prem Rawat in Delhi, India. In his address at the 124th Hans Jayanti Celebration in Delhi, Prem Rawat focused on the pursuit of true fulfillment and inner peace. He explained that honor and recognition are temporary and will eventually fade, urging the audience to focus on what truly matters‚Äîinner peace. Prem emphasized that peace and fulfillment are not found through external means but from within. He likened fulfillment to quenching thirst or hunger‚Äîboth can only be satisfied by experiencing them directly. Throughout his speech, Rawat encouraged the attendees to recognize that the power that drives the universe is always within them, no matter what challenges they may face. He reassured them that despite external struggles, as long as they connect with their inner sanctuary, everything will be well. His message was a reminder that the pursuit of happiness and fulfillment lies not in external circumstances but in discovering and experiencing the peace within oneself.

With your TimelessToday subscription — Premier (video) or Classic (audio) — you have full access to all of Prem Rawat’s premium content, including livestreams, replays, popular series and multilingual content.

4981ad6f-082d-4604-88ed-a062c9b09d3d.Description:
Amaroo 2016 Celebration Series


The unique and beloved ‚ÄúAmaroo‚Äù Series covers Prem Rawat‚Äôs addresses from 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2022, held at the Ivory‚Äôs Rock Conference Center in Queensland, Australia. 

As promised, TimelessToday now brings you the third morning session from 2016 for the first time. It is publicly available in English for two weeks ‚Äì without a TimelessToday subscription ‚Äì until Monday, April 18, 2023 at 8:00 p.m. PDT. Then the content will be exclusive to TimelessToday subscribers, including translations in French, Italian and Spanish as well as subtitles in other languages.

During this third morning session, Prem Rawat honored those people who helped him build inroads when he first came to the West in 1971, so that others could learn about what he offers and take full advantage. 

Starting in the United Kingdom, this effort then spread to America, Canada, Australia and Japan. He expressed wanting people who helped lay the foundation to feel a part of what he‚Äôs doing and what has been accomplished, so far. 

He spoke about the profound responsibility he has to ensure that his approach to self-Knowledge remains free of concepts and is available for generations to come. 

The fourth and last morning session will be made publicly available in two weeks and then rotated to being available only to Classic and Premier subscribers after the public showing. 

We encourage you to share this free offer with friends and family who might be interested.
Just click on Watch Amaroo 2016 Third Morning Session or go to the Series section on the TimelessToday mobile app or website to find Amaroo 2016. This is also where Classic and Premier subscribers can find the five afternoon sessions, to view at their convenience. 

Stay tuned for the release of the fourth and last morning session. Be sure to turn on notifications in the Settings of your TimelessToday app.

On the afternoon of September 12th, Prem emphasized the significance of the ‚Äúnow.‚Äù He explained that the present moment and existence are intertwined, and when experienced fully, they unlock a life of freedom.

4f7ad703-9a30-4f2e-baaf-9a183e55e985.Name: 2026 A New Year‚Äôs Message from Prem Rawat
4f7ad703-9a30-4f2e-baaf-9a183e55e985.Description:
A New Year‚Äôs Message from Prem Rawat

As this New Year arrives, turn your attention inward - 
to the peace that is already alive within you.

No matter what the past year held, this moment is new. This year is new.
And in this moment, you are breathing; you are alive.
Let that be the beginning.

May this year help you recognize the simple miracle of being here.
May you feel gratitude not as an idea, but as a living experience -
in your breath, in your heart, in the quiet awareness of now.

You do not have to chase peace.
You do not have to earn joy.
What you are looking for is closer than you think.

May this year be a year of understanding -
of listening more deeply, loving more simply,
and honoring the life that has been given to you.

Happy New Year.
May you experience the peace you already carry.

Prem Rawat

52942c8e-82b7-4021-a700-595d3ce8d857.Name: How It's Supposed to Be
52942c8e-82b7-4021-a700-595d3ce8d857.Description: Leave the noise behind. Embark on a path to peace within. Enjoy this 5:50-minute excerpt by Prem Rawat.

52ad0cc0-2dfd-4d83-bfb5-264c4caccdde.Name: Session 3: 124th Hans Jayanti Celebration
52ad0cc0-2dfd-4d83-bfb5-264c4caccdde.Description:
Replay of livestream with Prem Rawat in Delhi, India. In the third session of the 124th Hans Jayanti Anniversary event in Delhi, Prem Rawat captivated a large audience with stories, insights, and pressing questions about life‚Äôs objectives and the need for peace. Prem Rawat addressed the prevalence of greed in the world and shared his own commitment to spreading the message of peace to as many people as possible. In a world often overshadowed by material desires, he reminded everyone that true peace is essential for human completeness. This theme of peace will accompany him to Africa next, where he plans to speak in one of South Africa's most dangerous areas, where 1,000 people have recently received Knowledge. He discussed the impact of societal concepts that drive people‚Äôs actions without much reflection. Encouraging introspection, he stressed the importance of self-understanding and self-value as foundations for respecting others. Prem Rawat emphasized the urgent need to shift cultural norms, especially regarding respect for women. He envisioned a transformed society that values and honors women ‚Äî a culture that could serve as a model for the world. In closing, he left the audience with a thought-provoking question: "You are in charge of your life. What will you do with this time?" Through humor, warmth, and sincerity, Prem Rawat invited listeners to ponder the purpose and direction of their lives.

With your TimelessToday subscription — Premier (video) or Classic (audio) — you have full access to all of Prem Rawat’s premium content, including livestreams, replays, popular series and multilingual content.

5382fb6d-d3e7-4b4d-976b-5f73bdd58d71.Name: Know Your Self-Worth
5382fb6d-d3e7-4b4d-976b-5f73bdd58d71.Description:
Prem Rawat‚Äôs 2021 Canada Local Tour - Montreal


Prem Rawat‚Äôs message crossed many barriers on Sunday, September 26th, as he connected with people remotely via LiveStream and with those at the downtown venue in Montreal, Quebec.

The subjects flowed deep and practical‚Äîknowing yourself, feeling an innocence towards life, and how to discover real self-worth that overshadows insecurities.

Prem‚Äôs insights often lead to making better decisions in life and understanding the preciousness of today.


TimelessToday brings you the On-Demand Replay of this last stop on the Canada Tour with your Classic or Premier subscription.

53b263f9-5000-4070-9619-81d77b027440.Name: Elusive Now
53b263f9-5000-4070-9619-81d77b027440.Description: ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt understand the meaning of ‚Äúnow,‚Äù what is the point in trying to understand the meaning of tomorrow?‚Äù ‚Äì Prem Rawat

5411214f-04a2-4106-a8fb-422befa2c4b1.Name: Session 1, Focus 5
5411214f-04a2-4106-a8fb-422befa2c4b1.Description:
Amaroo 2022 with Prem Rawat | English


‚ÄúFocus 5‚Äù kicked off with Prem Rawat encouraging everyone to focus on what is real, what our heart needs. He reflected on the nature of doubt and how it leads to anxiety and fear. He expressed how we must learn to keep our hearts clear or doubt will come in.

Prem acknowledged that life is not always easy, but it is essential to remember to let ourselves be filled with gratitude for this life. As long as we are alive, everything is good and we can dig into our own strength.

 Our mission: To be in touch with yourself rather than focusing on the frequent distraction of technology and those things that take us away from what is real. He shared that being conscious is the only security system against the ‚Äúthief of time‚Äù taking away what cannot be replaced.

543b0cd8-5762-4b6c-9de5-f129bd2c4e3f.Name: The Human Equation
543b0cd8-5762-4b6c-9de5-f129bd2c4e3f.Description:
‚ÄúHear Yourself‚Äù Author Event with Prem Rawat in Buenos Aires ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between the sun and a flashlight?‚Äù Prem asked Delfina when she asked him to speak on the topic of finding real love in today‚Äôs complicated world. The conversation took place between Prem Rawat, author of ‚ÄúHear Yourself,‚Äù and Delfina Galarza, journalist from La Nacion Buenos Aires. It began with being at ease as an individual who‚Äôs paying attention to their life, and evolved into profound views into the singular divine within each individual. When Delfina asked Prem what would be the one key point he hopes readers get from his book, he replied: ‚ÄúInclude your heart in your life.‚Äù This special event commenced with Prem Rawat receiving the Golden Diploma, a lifetime award as an Honored Guest of the City of Buenos Aires for his services to Peace.

Still wondering about the difference between the Sun and the flashlight? Then enjoy this full-length replay in the TimelessToday app or website.

Fifty eight minutes, it is now available in English with a Classic or Premier subscription. Translation in other languages will soon be available.

The replay of this inspiring event is available free of charge in Spanish and Brazilian Portuguese.

545265c6-fbf2-47bb-99ad-418a71940d1d.Name: Fernando Trezza interviews Prem Rawat (Part 2)
545265c6-fbf2-47bb-99ad-418a71940d1d.Description:
Part 2: Brazilian Association of Community Channels, Sao Paulo, Brazil


In Sao Paulo, Brazil, the Words of Peace television series had been airing for over ten years reaching over 10 million homes in the city of Sao Paulo and over 40 million homes in all of Brazil. To celebrate this milestone in 2013, Fernando Mauro Trezza, President of the Brazilian Association of Community Channels, sat down with Prem Rawat to ask him about his work, his message and why peace matters.

Fernando Mauro Trezza: "For many people today, peace seems to be a boring subject. Can this perspective be changed?" 

Prem Rawat: "Of course, because they're coming from a concept of what peace is. They're not coming from the need. They have to feel the need."

55cce096-e496-4974-be9d-c5f02eb9e335.Name: Contentment
55cce096-e496-4974-be9d-c5f02eb9e335.Description: Prem Rawat came to South Africa to speak about peace in 1972. He was 14 years old. Nelson Mandela was in prison, serving a life sentence (before his 1990 publish) for his attempts to overturn its brutal Apartheid regime. When government officials discovered that the young Prem was addressing racially mixed audiences, they told him he could only speak to segregated racial groups. Prem refused, and the government blacklisted him. He was probably the youngest person ever to be blacklisted by the Apartheid regime for refusing to hold segregated events. Standing up to the regime was an extraordinary example of Prem‚Äôs courage.

55eaeec9-4ca0-44c7-9bac-7e0a03abd54d.Name: Beyond the World of Thoughts
55eaeec9-4ca0-44c7-9bac-7e0a03abd54d.Description:
Subject based excerpt from Prem Rawat ji's address during the 57th anniversary celebration


The energy present in every particle transcends our body and existence‚Äîit was there before us, it is here now, and it will remain after us. We can never be separate from this energy, but our desires and thoughts are distinct from it. It cannot be grasped through ideas or imagination but can only be experienced in the heart. This is the true understanding that needs to be known and realized.

5af0e2fb-977c-40ff-9b73-431d378b150f.Description:
The Complimentary Breakfast with Rian van Heerden Johannesburg, South Africa May 17, 2016


Although the systemized racial oppression of Apartheid was abolished in 1991, its legacy still haunts South Africa.

Rian van Heerden, host at Jacaranda radio in Johannesburg, South Africa, opens The Complimentary Breakfast Show with a provocative question, ‚ÄúWill South Africa ever truly experience peace?‚Äù

‚ÄúPeace is not a luxury. And peace is not a word. In fact, peace is a feeling. And like we need to sleep, like we need to eat, like we need to drink water, like we need to breathe air, we actually need peace in our lives.‚Äù

Prem continues, ‚ÄúWithout peace our functioning breaks down; our basic thinking breaks down. Our perceptions break down. And we no longer can function as a human being, properly.‚Äù

Jacaranda 94.2 FM is the largest independent radio station in South Africa and boasts a listening audience of 2 million people a week, and a digital community of more than 1.1 million people a month.

It‚Äôs the morning commute and Rian invites his audience to call in to speak with Prem.

Written by Francisca Matos

Session 4: Prem Rawat in Delhi In the finale of the 125th Hans Jayanti celebration, Prem Rawat spoke to over 20,000 viewers on the TimelessToday livestream about living more fully in the present. With gentle humor, he pointed out a modern paradox: we worry more about our phone's battery life than the breath we share with all humanity ‚Äî past and present. The same breath that flowed through ancient sages flows through us today. He emphasized that joy must be created now, not postponed. Doubt, he said, is the greatest obstacle to realizing our dreams. His message was clear: embrace this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to truly live, not just exist, and fill each moment with genuine joy.

125th Hans Jayanti Celebration with Prem Rawat in Delhi • 43 min. Enjoy any time on the TimelessToday app/website

Prem Rawat in Kyoto, Japan


On October 19, 2024, in Kyoto, Japan, moderator Mr. Hideki Yabuhara introduced author Prem Rawat and the much-anticipated release of the Japanese edition of his bestselling book Hear Yourself. 7256b1b2-53b8-4e6c-bfa8-8c6d67f9a2e2.Name: The Connection of Love
7256b1b2-53b8-4e6c-bfa8-8c6d67f9a2e2.Description:
Describing three worlds‚Äîthe natural world, the man-made, and one‚Äôs inner realm‚ÄîPrem Rawat directs us toward the value of knowing where to fulfill our innermost need for love. 

Speaking in Hindi during this last event in 2021, Prem Rawat gave an inkling of what might be in store for 2022, including more live and virtual events and training for Peace Education and Knowledge (PEAK) and Peace Education Program (PEP) facilitators. Also on the horizon is the further development of Intelligent Existence (IE) training to help anyone find peace in a noisy world.


English translation is now available for this full-length Replay of the Coventry event with your Classic or Premier subscription. Translations into French, German, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish will also be offered to subscribers as soon as possible.

Life Essentials, Episode 1, Part 2:  The Feeling of Belonging


What does it take to truly ‚Äúbelong?‚Äù In the first episode of our four-part series ‚ÄúLife Essentials,‚Äù Prem brings his unique‚Äîand often humorous‚Äîperspective to such life challenges as finding your place, recognizing your strengths‚Äîand learning from your mistakes. 72ac44b4-ebff-4b70-ab5e-0a7be0b31e7e.Name: Prem Rawat in Accra, Ghana
72ac44b4-ebff-4b70-ab5e-0a7be0b31e7e.Description:
Have you ever asked, ‚ÄúIf courage is in me, then why do I feel disappointed most of the time?‚Äù

This is one of many topics Prem Rawat addressed to an audience of 1,200 in Accra, Ghana, on August 18, 2016.

Accra, with a population of about 4 million, is the political and commercial capital of Ghana. Located on the coast of West Africa where the Atlantic Ocean meets the Gulf of Guinea, Ghana is a modern democratic country rich in natural resources, famous for its gold.

One of the humanitarian efforts of The Prem Rawat Foundation (TPRF) is the Peace Education Program (PEP), offered at institutions around the globe. The ten-week course includes videos of Prem speaking about the possibility of inner peace, exploring themes such as choice, dignity, hope, and contentment.

Many of the people who came to hear Prem Rawat speak at this event were introduced to him by the PEP. It was held in Accra‚Äôs uniquely designed National  Theater, where guests welcomed  him with great  enthusiasm.  Among them were 12 prison officials, including several in management.  Three tribal chiefs attended for their personal enjoyment. Visitors traveled from C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire, Benin, Burkina Faso, South Africa, and Europe.  Being with Prem in person was a first for a number of guests.

He said, ‚ÄúWhen you were a baby, you were an explorer! And all of you in your life  have accomplished a feat that is unimaginable. Against all odds. Many times you failed.  But you never accepted failure. And you know what that was? You learned to walk.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs two of you‚Äù, he continued, ‚ÄúThere is the one now ‚Äî and then there was  the  one  when  you were a baby. Who are you?  The one now?  Or the courageous one?

‚ÄùThe audience laughed appreciatively at Prem‚Äôs gifted storytelling and took to heart his urging to recognize the inner resource they have had since they were babies: ‚Äúcourage beyond belief.‚Äù

Amaroo 2022 with Prem Rawat


On the final morning of the Focus 5, Prem Rawat reflected on the key lessons shared during this Amaroo 2022 experience. The session was moved into a new location due to heavy rains Thursday evening. Independent of any external challenges, Prem‚Äôs message was clear and powerful. He used the analogy of a water bottle never being as important as drinking the water.

He reminded the Amaroo attendees and the TimelessToday‚Äôs livestream audience that once you embark on the journey to know who you are, during this life it will never end. The beauty and experience of life is about discovery, discovery of a lifetime, your lifetime. Except for that which is real.‚Äù

83230d35-7089-4e8a-9bd1-2ccad1f48829.Name: Baisakhi Celebrations
83230d35-7089-4e8a-9bd1-2ccad1f48829.Description:
Prem Rawat in Delhi, India The Baisakhi season brings all of India together in joyful celebration. Farmers gather their spring harvests, and communities across the nation express gratitude for nature's bounty and they sow seeds of hope for future prosperity. This year held special significance as Prem Rawat returned to India after many years since attending his last Baisakhi event. His father, Shri Hans, had started a tradition of inviting people to gather during this joyful time, to listen to a message of personal peace. With wisdom and passion, Prem Rawat renewed this tradition on April 13, 2025 and reminded everyone how precious life is and to know and understand the heart‚Äôs full potential for joy. The 80-minute replay of this very special occasion includes a 7-minute video highlighting the meaning of Baisakhi.

Stay informed by joining the TimelessToday mailing list.

83751302-7003-4b4c-af63-9e5538299497.Name: Prem Rawat in Barcelona
83751302-7003-4b4c-af63-9e5538299497.Description:
None of the things that are happening in your life actually have any weight. None of them. None of them have any weight, whatsoever. Except in your mind, you will give them weight. Except in your mind, you will give them gravity. Except in your mind, you will give them a size. Except in your mind you will give them an importance. Except in your mind, and only in your mind, they will weigh you down.

- Prem Rawat

The event took place in Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh, India, shattering the previous record of 20,264‚Äîheld by J.K. Rowling of Harry Potter fame and two Canadian authors. This achievement marks Prem Rawat‚Äôs 3rd Guinness World Record. Enjoy the replay and experience these two authors setting the new record.

86f0c4d5-702f-4eea-917c-c8d276de3209.Description:
Life-changing teachers through the ages have taught that peace lies within. One such teacher was Hans RƒÅm Singh Rawat, the father of Prem Rawat, who began spreading the knowledge of inner peace across India at age thirty-two. Hans believed that all religions come from a single source and every person has the potential to experience it.
 
As we celebrate Hans‚Äô 119th birthday, Prem honors his father's legacy in a speech held in  Los Angeles. Prem was inspired by his father‚Äôs teachings from a young age, witnessing the profound silence when his father spoke to large crowds. Hans was a visionary who believed in equality, regardless of caste ‚Äì a revolutionary stance at the time.
 
After Hans‚Äô passing, Prem stepped into his father‚Äôs role, continuing the message of peace in his own way. In this special event, Prem shares a heartfelt message about the power of dreams, where the dreamer and the dream become one.

8b0cbee5-01a8-460b-ae38-2d4128f52e2b.Name: Session 8, Amaroo 2024
8b0cbee5-01a8-460b-ae38-2d4128f52e2b.Description:
5-Day conference with Prem Rawat in Ivorys Rock, Australia


On this final morning of Amaroo 2024, 13th September, Prem strongly encouraged everyone to take advantage of the opportunity and need to put the practice of Knowledge into action.

He suggested that we don‚Äôt need our concepts to feel the beauty of the divine. We are a part of that river that flows stating ‚Äúyour shape may be different, but your content isn‚Äôt.‚Äù

He opened the session up to those who wanted to express themselves to him, with smiles and wisdom he welcomed the range of love shared.

At the end of the morning session, Prem surprised the audience and Lem Lasher, the former TimelessToday CEO, with an appreciation award for his efforts.

8b0fae00-d665-44c9-a30e-db9afb2747f9.Name: Session 7, 50th Anniversary
8b0fae00-d665-44c9-a30e-db9afb2747f9.Description:
Amaroo 2016 Celebration Series


Prem Rawat in Ivory's Rock Conference and Events Center, Ipswich, 2016. 
A 5-day conference celebrating the 50th anniversary of his relentless efforts to spread the message of peace.

For the past 50 years, Prem Rawat has been focused on one simple goal ‚Äì to communicate his message of peace to as many people as possible.  His efforts have been relentless and the results have been extraordinary ‚Äì but never as extraordinary as this past year. Indeed, in 2016, Prem reached more people than ever before.

In September 2016, 4,500 of these people attended a five-day event with Prem at the Ivory‚Äôs Rock Conference and Event Center (aka Amaroo) in Australia. By all accounts, the event was a most remarkable one.

Today, in honor of the holiday season and the many requests we‚Äôve received, we are happy to announce the launch of an online 50th Anniversary Gift Set.  This comprehensive collection includes nine of Prem‚Äôs addresses from the 5-day celebration with material not seen before on TimelessToday.  It also features many of the extraordinary stories he told in Amaroo from the Mahabharata ‚Äì a classic Indian epic infused with enduring principles still relevant today.

 Written by Mitch Ditkoff

8b7be7fb-e0f9-4c01-89ae-33ddf314ae2b.Name: Just One Drop
8b7be7fb-e0f9-4c01-89ae-33ddf314ae2b.Description:

8c054695-7e32-4881-94d5-9ab6b1d48dc1.Description: There are 3.4 million people living in Cape Town these days ‚Äì South Africa‚Äôs second most populous city. On May 9th 2016, three of its lively citizens met with Prem Rawat for a few hours of spirited conversation. A hearty shout out to Lumka Ngxoli, Robin Lee Pretorius, and Fluffy O‚ÄôPanda ‚Äì delightful hosts of Assembly Radio‚Äôs Wild Wise Women show ‚Äì for their insightful and entertaining interview. It all happened ‚Äì the laughter, the banter, and the extraordinary rapport ‚Äì at Assembly Radio, an online media outlet that caters to a trendy listening audience of 10,000 15-35 year olds. The interview, both hilarious and profound, is one you will not soon forget. Written by Mitch Ditkoff

8c9f40da-7384-4282-b9f4-cd92135f953f.Name: 2020 A Heartfelt Resolution
8c9f40da-7384-4282-b9f4-cd92135f953f.Description: Year after year we tend to reflect on external things we want to change, making assumptions that if things were different, we would be happier. But the happiness we seek won't be found on the outside‚Äîit exists within us.   In a very special New Year‚Äôs Day message, Prem encourages us to make a new kind of resolution, not just for ourselves based on external happiness, but for a better world and a better future‚Äîa resolution that comes from the heart.

8cfdd509-8ff0-46ba-bede-c22e715b6b75.Name: Prem Rawat on South Africa fm News Radio
8cfdd509-8ff0-46ba-bede-c22e715b6b75.Description: There are 53 million people living in South Africa, the only country in the world that borders both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans.  On December 8th, 11 million of these people had a rare opportunity to listen to a live interview with Prem Rawat on South Africa‚Äôs oldest radio station, SAfm. The interviewer, long time-radio host, Rowena Baird, began the show with a bold declaration.  ‚ÄúInternational Peace Ambassador, Mr. Prem Rawat‚Äù, she explained, ‚Äúwas going to share some tips on how to eliminate violence through reconciliation, hope, and forgiveness.‚Äù  Bold, indeed, and timely, too. Returning to a country that had blacklisted him for refusing to abide by Apartheid principles at his Johannesburg public event in 1972,  Prem was now being given a country-wide platform to share his message of peace.  Which is precisely what he did for 13 power-packed minutes.  Responding to Ms. Baird‚Äôs questions with his own unique brand of straight talk, storytelling, and humor, Prem laid it all on the line ‚Äì especially in response to the last question ‚Äì about his specific message for South Africans. ‚ÄúYou have the power,‚Äù he exclaimed.  ‚ÄúAll you need is that determination. Don‚Äôt look at other people. Look at yourself.  From the strength of you ‚Äì you can change a nation.‚Äù Written by Mitch Ditkoff

In this moving talk at the international retreat in Queensland Australia last year, Prem answers questions texted from the audience, and speaks about the power of clarity in the face of adversity. Find the light that is in you, he urged, and look for the clear path, not the obstacles, in your life.

8fea38e5-3bca-4c18-a54f-d503d97a16ba.Description:
Amaroo 2022 with Prem Rawat


In this Amaroo session, Prem Rawat highlights the work he does with The Prem Rawat Foundation (TPRF) and invites a distinguished panel on to the stage to discuss the incredible impact that the Peace Education Program is having on people around the world.

The group shares how the program got its humble start 10 years ago and has now reached 300,000 people in 80 countries. They share profound stories of how the program is transforming the lives of university students, gang members, incarcerated people and more.

 Prem Rawat outlines how the program has become a key part of his outreach and celebrates the people who are helping make it happen. He also notes how the TPRF Food for People program is helping break the cycle of poverty in disadvantaged communities. At a follow-up meeting, Prem was able to spend some time with a group of TPRF volunteers from around the world.

Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) presents the message of peace of Prem Rawat and undertakes humanitarian activities to bring harmony in life. It organises live events with Prem Rawat and video events related to his message. His message is‚ÄîPeace is Possible for everyone and that peace is a fundamental need of every human being.
The organisation is dedicated to helping people explore human potential, the joy of being alive and experiencing peace. RVK in its endeavour to improve the quality of human life offers many humanitarian services, including Free Eye Clinics and Food for People in remote areas. It also supports other organisations having similar charitable, social and philanthropic goals.

Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) shares and supports the vision that peace is possible in everybody‚Äôs life. This can happen only when each individual takes personal responsibility and discovers personal peace within. Its activities are supported by voluntary contributions of individuals who appreciate this message. 

Helping You Discover Personal Peace Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) invites Prem Rawat to address people interested in his message of Self-discovery and Self-knowledge. His addresses are very much appreciated and over 50 million people have benefited from them. The number of attendees often exceeds 300,000 at events addressed by Prem Rawat. Prem Rawat presents and offers a practical way to focus within to enjoy the experience of peace inside. Peace Education Programme - From Darkness Into Light. Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) also organises events regularly in jails across the country. His message has helped many prisoners to revert back to the normal life of a law-abiding citizen.

90YWlfMwkLY.Name: The Presence in the Present
90YWlfMwkLY.Description:
‚ÄúWater has no shape. Air has no color. But when the two come together, they become a cloud. You can see it, and it‚Äôs changing so fast. What does it have in it? It has in it the promise of that one drop of rain. That one drop that can transform, that can change an arid desert into the most magnificent garden. That‚Äôs the promise.
Toronto, Canada. Sunday 13 July 2014

91289ce1-7d9b-473b-8278-304979fe18fd.Name: The Bridge Keeper
91289ce1-7d9b-473b-8278-304979fe18fd.Description:
Guru Puja Celebration, 2025


"The Bridge Keeper" is about the relationship between a student and teacher on the path to understanding life's deeper meaning. Using images of water and bridges, the poem describes someone who helps others move from everyday struggles to lasting truth.

The poem explores an interesting idea ‚Äî how we sometimes need another person's help to discover who we really are. Based on ancient Sanskrit texts and brought into modern language, it connects with anyone who has looked for guidance during difficult times. It suggests that true transformation requires a master who lights the path of self-knowledge‚Äîsomeone whose wisdom helps us experience our life force within.

912b7124-9ef4-40b8-b9c2-41d71f025e19.Description: Prior to his public address in Milan in mid-June, Prem met with journalist Gianluca Tizi of the Italian national newspaper "La Repubblica Milano." In a touching interview Prem talks about, among other things, the possibility for personal change (regardless of one's past)‚Äîand why he hasn't gotten into politics.

9154e6fa-00e2-4a4a-8a4b-3e1b45d87919.Name: Winning the War
9154e6fa-00e2-4a4a-8a4b-3e1b45d87919.Description: Not feeling ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù every moment of every day? What‚Äôs important is making the effort. Peace is about the big picture, not every battle.

Prem Rawat is preparing to present his Peace Education Program (PEP), a course aimed at self discovery of our inner resources. As a lead up, the daily "Lockdown‚Äù will feature stories from PEP participants around the world.

92b373d4-e964-49c5-b21a-36c57a6b108d.Name: Session 5, 50th Anniversary
92b373d4-e964-49c5-b21a-36c57a6b108d.Description:
Amaroo 2016 Celebration Series


Prem Rawat in Ivory's Rock Conference and Events Center, Ipswich, 2016. 
A 5-day conference celebrating the 50th anniversary of his relentless efforts to spread the message of peace.

For the past 50 years, Prem Rawat has been focused on one simple goal ‚Äì to communicate his message of peace to as many people as possible.  His efforts have been relentless and the results have been extraordinary ‚Äì but never as extraordinary as this past year. Indeed, in 2016, Prem reached more people than ever before.

In September 2016, 4,500 of these people attended a five-day event with Prem at the Ivory‚Äôs Rock Conference and Event Center (aka Amaroo) in Australia. By all accounts, the event was a most remarkable one.

Today, in honor of the holiday season and the many requests we‚Äôve received, we are happy to announce the launch of an online 50th Anniversary Gift Set.  This comprehensive collection includes nine of Prem‚Äôs addresses from the 5-day celebration with material not seen before on TimelessToday.  It also features many of the extraordinary stories he told in Amaroo from the Mahabharata ‚Äì a classic Indian epic infused with enduring principles still relevant today.

Written by Mitch Ditkoff

92e74f87-ccb8-4633-8844-b51b9e6cabe1.Description:
Prem Rawat in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia


In the midst of an ever-changing world, where do we find our anchor? On October 27, best-selling author and global Ambassador of Peace Prem Rawat spoke with Malaysia TV presenter Kanchana Nanda Kumar about the inner strength that comes with personal peace. Prem also interacted with the young winners of the 2018 Storytelling Competition. 

The competition featured stories from Prem‚Äôs widely-acclaimed book, Splitting the Arrow, and was organized by Navagon Digital Sdn Bhd in partnership with Kifubon Malaysia. (Kifubon is a group that promotes peaceful coexistence through the sharing of donated, inspirational books with primary schools, prisons, and other institutions.)


Enjoy this LiveStream Replay in English. Spanish will be available soon.

92fc8261-eef2-40bf-8095-ea70c4e596ff.Name: Positive News
92fc8261-eef2-40bf-8095-ea70c4e596ff.Description: Barred from South Africa during apartheid for taking a stand against racism, International Ambassador of Peace and speaker Prem Rawat has returned to the country carrying his message of peace during his 16 days of activism tour. Along with his message of peace, Rawat talks the Business of Life and emphasizes that it is the most important thing. ‚ÄúWhen life is not right nothing else falls into place. When you don‚Äôt feel alive, everything else just seems so static‚Äù, he says. Asked about the importance of living a balanced life; Rawat says ‚ÄúLife will be balanced if those forces that throw it out of balance are removed. Life wants balance ‚Äì there is a want for joy, there is a want for happiness. There is no limit on how happy we can be but for sadness, fear, pain, anger we definitely have low tolerance and that right there tells us something‚Äù

On May 16, 2025, Prem Rawat celebrated his 100th event in Japan since 1972. He addressed the universal challenge of embracing life amid personal difficulties. And he emphasized the importance of recognizing our authentic selves beneath societal masks.

The event featured "EVOLUTION: A Decade of Effort and Growth," a 12-minute video showcasing innovative tools developed to share Prem Rawat's message of inner peace and Self-Knowledge across all demographics. An Audience with Prem Rawat is a brand-new series of audio podcasts from the sell-out 2017 World Tour.

Listen to Prem Rawat offer his unique perspective on the pathway to peace and how we can all reconnect with our essential humanity, in the face of seismic global change.

In conversation with a new host at each event, Prem explores different themes of self-discovery, as well as answering burning questions from the audience.

In a way that only Prem Rawat can do, you will see that the answers are never far away.

9e1f3904-17c4-434a-84c3-4ca94d25d482.Name: Session 9, Focus 5
9e1f3904-17c4-434a-84c3-4ca94d25d482.Description:
Amaroo 2022 with Prem Rawat


During this final Focus 5 Amaroo 2022 session Prem translates Hindi and English weaving in a mix of traditional Indian stories and modern examples. He reflected that in today‚Äôs world the value of a human being is disappearing. While we might live in a time of  political correctness, it hasn‚Äôt resulted in a sense of closeness, rather we are more and more divided.

Prem reminds us that we look for love and kindness in the environment, not realizing that what we are looking for is inside. As he has stated for years, it is only when each of us becomes kind that society will be  kind. Dedicate your life to understanding  the Divine, without concepts but by personal experience. Concepts are the drug that gets in our way.

What does it take to truly ‚Äúbelong?‚Äù In the first episode of our four-part series ‚ÄúLife Essentials,‚Äù Prem brings his unique‚Äîand often humorous‚Äîperspective to such life challenges as finding your place, recognizing your strengths‚Äîand learning from your mistakes. Recorded in Belfast, Northern Ireland with stand-up comedian Ryan McDonnell as MC, the release includes Prem answering questions texted to him by the audience.

Enjoy it‚Äîas well as all upcoming episodes in this series.

Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) presents the message of peace of Prem Rawat and undertakes humanitarian activities to bring harmony in life. It organises live events with Prem Rawat and video events related to his message. His message is‚ÄîPeace is Possible for everyone and that peace is a fundamental need of every human being.
The organisation is dedicated to helping people explore human potential, the joy of being alive and experiencing peace. RVK in its endeavour to improve the quality of human life offers many humanitarian services, including Free Eye Clinics and Food for People in remote areas. It also supports other organisations having similar charitable, social and philanthropic goals.

Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) shares and supports the vision that peace is possible in everybody‚Äôs life. This can happen only when each individual takes personal responsibility and discovers personal peace within. Its activities are supported by voluntary contributions of individuals who appreciate this message. 

Helping You Discover Personal Peace Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) invites Prem Rawat to address people interested in his message of Self-discovery and Self-knowledge. His addresses are very much appreciated and over 50 million people have benefited from them. The number of attendees often exceeds 300,000 at events addressed by Prem Rawat. Prem Rawat presents and offers a practical way to focus within to enjoy the experience of peace inside. Peace Education Programme - From Darkness Into Light. Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) also organises events regularly in jails across the country. His message has helped many prisoners to revert back to the normal life of a law-abiding citizen.

BbeXqrk-Uxk.Name: Amaroo 2024 Session 8 (A glimpse)
BbeXqrk-Uxk.Description:
‚ÄúAllow yourself to be distracted from your problems, because an incredible candy has been handed to you.It‚Äôs called ‚ÄúKnowledge!  Go within and truly taste the magnificent sweetness of being alive.‚Äù Prem Rawat

On this final morning of Amaroo 2024, 13th September, Prem strongly encouraged everyone to take advantage of the opportunity and need to put the practice of Knowledge into action. He suggested that we don‚Äôt need our concepts to feel the beauty of the divine. We are a part of that river that flows stating ‚Äúyour shape may be different, but your content isn‚Äôt.‚Äù 

He opened the session up to those who wanted to express themselves to him, with smiles and wisdom he welcomed the range of love shared. 

A surprise to all, at the end the morning session, including Lem Lasher, the former TimelessToday CEO was an award from Prem in appreciation of his efforts.

DoQaqhvwPZY.Name: The Importance of Peace: Prem Rawat
DoQaqhvwPZY.Description:
In June 2014, Prem Rawat was the keynote speaker at Central Hall, Westminster, for an event sponsored by the Water and Food Award (WAFA). At this event, WAFA celebrated humanitarian efforts that have initiated the most innovative, sustainable and replicable projects to provide nutritious food and clean water to those most in need. 
‚ÄúIn a way, all our efforts that we are trying to make, whether it is sustainability, whether it is to feed the hungry, whether it is to bring clean water‚Äîin our own little way, we want to create a little heaven right here on earth. And who will ever blame us for thinking so wildly? Because that is a wild vision‚Äîto want to create a little heaven for us and for our fellow beings. And to leave a legacy of that heaven for the generations yet to come, so they keep on living the dream of creating a little heaven in their time, for the time ahead of them.‚Äù
The Importance of Peace, Westminster, London 140618

On the afternoon of 11th of September, Prem asked Paul Bloomfield, who manages the Public Relations Office,  to provide the Amaroo attendees with a global perspective about the on-going efforts that he has inspired.

From Cuba to Soweto, Malaysia to John Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland, the story is compelling and to a significant degree understated.

Paul invited a range of speakers including TPRF team members, Dr.Raj Mukherjee, Neurosurgeon, the list goes on and on to share their experience.

FEQTLY-s7mc.Name: "The Shadow and You" On-Demand Replay of Prem Rawat Live
FEQTLY-s7mc.Description:
‚ÄúThe peace is already inside of you; whatever is masking that peace has to be unmasked. The process really is of undoing, rather than doing.‚Äù ‚ÄîPrem Rawat

More than 4,800 viewers from 73 countries tuned in for this first-ever ‚ÄúPrem Rawat LIVE‚Äù broadcast, and 600 sponsors from 42 countries gave their generous support.

While there were some technical issues, the platform allowed Prem to share his deeply powerful message about individual fulfillment and peace.

The English Replay of ‚ÄúPrem Rawat LIVE‚Äù is now available. French, Spanish, German, Italian, Hindi and Portuguese will be available in 3-4 days.

How to watch Replay?

If you registered for ‚ÄúPrem Rawat LIVE‚Äù you can access the Replay at https://www.livewithpremrawat.com/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=des using your login created on that platform until August 31.

Missed the LIVE broadcast?

‚ÄúIt is so easy to get discouraged. And so difficult, it seems, to have courage. But without that courage, there is no going forward.‚Äù  - Prem Rawat

Speaking in Peak Crossing, Australia during a small group training session on October 15, Prem Rawat shared his perspective on the need for courage while the conflict in the Middle East unfolds.

TimelessToday¬Æ is sharing this content as a reminder of the precious nature of life, especially during times such as these when we need to find courage, commit to going forward, and to be safe.

JiN8AU5cjqk.Name: What Is Shaping You?: Prem Rawat in Dublin
JiN8AU5cjqk.Description:
Prem Rawat returned to Dublin on July 27, 2025, two years after his last visit, for an inspiring author event. Paul Congdon, owner of Positive Life magazine, introduced Prem and his latest book with characteristic Irish warmth.

‚ÄúThe world is going to try to shape you. ‚ÄòYou should be doing this and you should be doing that.‚Äô Let kindness, joy, understanding and knowledge of the self shape you. Then this life isn‚Äôt a nightmare but something to celebrate.‚Äù Prem Rawat

As he so often does, Prem Rawat shared a powerful metaphor: just as the sun provides all colors that objects reflect back, the divine offers a spectrum of human qualities ‚Äî joy, peace, kindness and love ‚Äî that become our true "colors."
 
He explored the tension between the world's external pressures and the divine's gentle guidance toward the authentic self where the nature of peace and understanding reside.

Central to his message: Breath is our most precious and overlooked gift, connecting us to all life and serving as a gateway to the ancient wisdom "Know thyself."

The full video is available for TimelessToday Classic and Premier subscribers through the app and website.

JqOrIF6I_TA.Name: Amaroo 2024 Session 7 (A glimpse)
JqOrIF6I_TA.Description:
‚ÄúDon't try to create a new ‚Äúnow‚Äù. There is a genuine ‚Äúnow‚Äù that exists. Be in sync with that ‚Äúnow.‚Äù Prem Rawat

On the afternoon of 12th of September, Prem‚Äôs message focused on the ‚Äúnow‚Äù.  He shared his perspective that ‚Äònow‚Äô and existence are a tandem that when truly experienced enables a life of freedom, and that ‚Äònow‚Äù is where that package that is you exists.  It‚Äôs not about other people‚Äôs ‚Äúnow‚Äù , it is your own ‚Äúsphere of now.‚Äù The practice of Knowledge, not filled with other people‚Äôs ideas and concepts, opens you to your now. 

With one more day on the Amaroo 2024 calendar, Prem reflected on how fast the time has passed.

PBP4Shgihp8.Description:
Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) presents the message of peace of Prem Rawat and undertakes humanitarian activities to bring harmony in life. It organises live events with Prem Rawat and video events related to his message. His message is‚ÄîPeace is Possible for everyone and that peace is a fundamental need of every human being.
The organisation is dedicated to helping people explore human potential, the joy of being alive and experiencing peace. RVK in its endeavour to improve the quality of human life offers many humanitarian services, including Free Eye Clinics and Food for People in remote areas. It also supports other organisations having similar charitable, social and philanthropic goals.

Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) shares and supports the vision that peace is possible in everybody‚Äôs life. This can happen only when each individual takes personal responsibility and discovers personal peace within. Its activities are supported by voluntary contributions of individuals who appreciate this message. 

Helping You Discover Personal Peace Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) invites Prem Rawat to address people interested in his message of Self-discovery and Self-knowledge. His addresses are very much appreciated and over 50 million people have benefited from them. The number of attendees often exceeds 300,000 at events addressed by Prem Rawat. Prem Rawat presents and offers a practical way to focus within to enjoy the experience of peace inside. Peace Education Programme - From Darkness Into Light. Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) also organises events regularly in jails across the country. His message has helped many prisoners to revert back to the normal life of a law-abiding citizen.
Raj Vidya Kender (RVK) is a non-¬≠profit registered charitable organization

PCZ2RO2M83A.Name: Ageless Heart: Prem Rawat in Athens
PCZ2RO2M83A.Description:
‚ÄúYou have this beautiful possibility ‚Äì not as a Greek, not as a French, not as a German, not as an Englishman ‚Äì but as a human being, to be fulfilled.‚Äù  Prem Rawat

Returning to Athens, Greece on June 29, 2024, Prem Rawat asked the audience why, despite thousands of years of shared wisdom, it hasn‚Äôt taken hold and transformed human beings.

He explained that fear, jealousy and doubt often compete with understanding the qualities of the heart. ‚ÄúIt takes courage,‚Äù he said. Embracing the heart sows the seeds of kindness and humanity, seeds with which every human being is born. These seeds cannot sow themselves, but once they are sown, they contain everything a person needs to thrive and become who they are meant to be.

You can now watch or listen to the Athens, Greece replay in English at your convenience with your Classic or Premier subscription.
